title: Definitions
context: [ยง553A-1] Definitions. As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;Adult&rdquo; means an individual who has attained the age of twenty-one years. &ldquo;Benefit plan&rdquo; means an employer&rsquo;s plan for the benefit of an employee or partner. &ldquo;Broker&rdquo; means a person lawfully engaged in the business of effecting transactions in securities or commodities for the person&rsquo;s own account or for the account of others. &ldquo;Conservator&rdquo; means a person appointed or qualified by a court to act as general, limited, or temporary guardian of a minor&rsquo;s property or a person legally authorized to perform substantially the same functions. &ldquo;Court&rdquo; means the circuit court of the State. &ldquo;Custodial property&rdquo; means (1) any interest in property transferred to a custodian under this chapter and (2) the income from and proceeds of that interest in property. &ldquo;Custodian&rdquo; means a person so designated under section 553A-9 or a successor or substitute custodian designated under section 553A-18. &ldquo;Financial institution&rdquo; means a bank, trust company, savings institution, or credit union, chartered and supervised under state or federal law. &ldquo;Legal representative&rdquo; means an individual&rsquo;s personal representative or conservator. &ldquo;Member of the minor&rsquo;s family&rdquo; means the minor&rsquo;s parent, stepparent, spouse, grandparent, brother, sister, uncle, or aunt, whether of the whole or half blood or by adoption. &ldquo;Minor&rdquo; means an individual who has not attained the age of twenty-one years. &ldquo;Person&rdquo; means an individual, corporation, organization, or other legal entity. &ldquo;Personal representative&rdquo; means an executor, administrator, successor personal representative, or special administrator of a decedent&rsquo;s estate or a person legally authorized to perform substantially the same functions. &ldquo;State&rdquo; includes any state of the United States, the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, and any territory or possession subject to the legislative authority of the United States. &ldquo;Transfer&rdquo; means a transaction that creates custodial property under section 553A-9. &ldquo;Transferor&rdquo; means a person who makes a transfer under this chapter. &ldquo;Trust company&rdquo; means a financial institution, corporation, or other legal entity, authorized to exercise general trust powers. [L 1985, c 91, pt of ยง1]
